textContent:
Skills are specific categories for different capabilities that players may have. Fire magic is a skill, and so is Blacksmithing, and Entertainment, etc.

Players can gain points for every skill, but they only have a limited amount of skill points to spend. If they reach the max, they won't gain any more points into any skill. They can choose to lose points from any skill they have learnt, block skills to not gain points in them, etc.

All skills have a talent tree (similar to Dragonflight's, with branching paths), but in order to invest in a skill you need both the points AND "grasp". You need to grasp most spells before you are able to learn them (usually through a quest). The more points you invest in a skill, the further down you can go in the tree.

This talent trees apply to non-combat skills too, like crafting and gathering ones, for both improved efficiency, range of recipes and new capabilities altogether.
